contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Expand Portuguese|Indaiatuba|date=January 2010}} {{Coord|23|05|25|S|47|13|05|W|scale:30000|display=title}} [[File:Vista noturna de Indaiatuba SP.jpg|thumb|Indaiatuba during the [[night]].]] '''Indaiatuba''' is a municipality in the state of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]] in [[Brazil]]. The population in 2011 was 205.808 and its area is 311,363 km². The elevation is 624 m. The city's name derives from the [[Tupi language]]. It is an important city in one of Brazil's main industrial regions. Based on the latest IFDM social index data, Indaiatuba ranks number one of the "Top 100 best cities to live, in Brazil". The Federation of Industries of Rio de Janeiro, surveyed data and compared information on education, health, income and employment (wage and average generation of formal jobs) of all municipalities in the country and, with this data they created the Firjan Development Index Municipal (IFDM), so it was possible to create the rank of the top 100 cities to live in Brazil. (The levels of violence however is not included in this study) Data was collected from the Ministries of Education, Health and Labour for all municipalities. == External links == * [http://www.indaiatuba.sp.gov.br/ Indaiatuba Official Page] {{pt}} {[http://poppop.com.br/curiosidades/ranking-com-as-100-melhores-cidades-do-brasil-para-se-viver-e-morar/]} {[http://www.firjan.org.br/ifdm/consulta-ao-indice/consulta-ao-indice-grafico.htm?UF=SP&IdCidade=352050&Indicador=1&Ano=2010]} {{São Paulo state|Campinas}} [[Category:Populated places in São Paulo (state)]] {{SaoPauloState-geo-stub}}
